sentences.en: "Oh, I despair sometimes," he says in mock sorrow.
sentences.cn: “啊，我有时会感到绝望，”他假装悲伤地说。

sentences.en: A thread of sorrow winds through her poetry.
sentences.cn: 她的诗流露出一缕忧思.

sentences.en: As he looked at Katherine, great sorrow clouded his eyes.
sentences.cn: 他看着凯瑟琳，满眼忧伤。

sentences.en: Gertrude now clearly felt that she had obtruded her sorrow.
sentences.cn: 格特鲁德此时明显察觉自己的悲伤情绪已影响到他人。

sentences.en: He expressed his sorrow at the news of her death.
sentences.cn: 听到她的死讯，他表示哀伤。

sentences.en: He felt a great weight of sorrow inside him.
He said that his decision to resign was made more in sorrow than in anger.
sentences.cn: 他说他作出辞职的决定与其说是出于气愤，不如说是因为悲伤。

sentences.en: I must convert sorrow into strength.
I think she did it more in sorrow than in anger.
sentences.cn: 我觉得她这样做更多是出于悲哀而不是愤恨.

sentences.en: It helps to share your sorrow with someone else.
sentences.cn: 向他人诉说你的痛苦对你是有益的.

sentences.en: Sighing for sorrow can be harmful.
The composer expresses his sorrow in his music.
sentences.cn: 这位作曲家用音乐表达他的悲伤.

sentences.en: When her child died, her cup of sorrow seemed complete.
sentences.cn: 孩子死后, 她陷入极度悲痛中.
言语无法表达我的哀伤。

sentences.en: Your visit will take away the sting of her sorrow.
sentences.cn: 您的来访会消除她的悲伤.

words.tran_cn: 遗憾的；对不起的，抱歉的
对不起，抱歉（表示委婉的拒绝等）

trans.tran_en: a feeling of great sadness, usually because someone has died or because something terrible has happened to you
